simple.gui.factory

Class SJPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.gui.factory.SJPanel

  • public final class SJPanel
extends Object
    Makes JPanels of all kinds!
    Created: Mar 6, 2009
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

    • Method Detail

      • makeLabeledPanel

        public static JPanel makeLabeledPanel(String title)
        Used to create a preformatted JPanel with a JLabel bound to the left using a BorderLayout. Used by Form to create the labeled text boxes.
        Parameters:
        title - Text to be displayed on the left.
        Returns:
        A new JPanel with a JLabel on the left with title set as its text.

      • makeLabeledPanel

        public static JPanel makeLabeledPanel(String title,
                      String orient)
        Variant of makeLabeledPanel(String). Lets you decide whether the text is displayed on the left or the right.
        Parameters:
        title - Text to be displayed.
        orient - One of LEFT or RIGHT.
        Returns:
        A new JPanel with a JLabel at orient with title set as its text.

      • makeLabeledPanel

        public static JPanel makeLabeledPanel(JComponent c,
                      String title)
        Extended version of makeLabeledPanel(String).
        Creates new JPanel and adds a JLabel on the left with text title and the JComponent c.
        Parameters:
        c - JComonent to be added.
        title - Text to be displayed on the left.
        Returns:
        The created JPanel.

      • makeLabeledPanel2

                       String title)
        Creates new JPanel and adds a JLabel on the left with text title and the JComponent c.
        Parameters:
        c - JComponent to be added.
        title - Text to be displayed on the left.
        Returns:
        The created JPanel.

      • makeLabeledPanel

        public static JPanel makeLabeledPanel(JComponent c,
                      String title,
                      String orient)
        Extended version of makeLabeledPanel(String, String). Variant of makeLabeledPanel(JComponent, String). Allows you to set the orient of the JLabel.
        Parameters:
        c - JComponent to be added.
        title - Text to be displayed.
        orient - One of LEFT or RIGHT.
        Returns:
        The resulting JPanel.

        Returns:

      • makeTitledPanel

        public static JPanel makeTitledPanel(String title,
                     LayoutManager m)
        Creates an empty JPanel with a TitledBorder and sets the LayoutManager to m.
        Parameters:
        title - Title to be displayed.
        m - LayoutManager to use.
        Returns:
        The resulting JPanel.

      • makeTitledPanel

                     String title,
                     LayoutManager m)

                     String title,
                     LayoutManager m)

      • makeTitledPanel

        public static JPanel makeTitledPanel(JComponent[] c,
                     String title,
                     int axis)
        Creates a JPanel with BoxLayout as its LayoutManager. Adds a TitledBorder to the JPanel and adds each element of c.
        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to be added.
        title - Title to be displayed.
        axis - One of (@link javax.swing.BoxLayout#PAGE_AXIS}, (@link javax.swing.BoxLayout#X_AXIS}, (@link javax.swing.BoxLayout#Y_AXIS}, (@link javax.swing.BoxLayout#PAGE_AXIS}.
        Returns:
        The resulting JPanel.
        See Also:
        BoxLayout

      • makeBoxLayoutPanelX

        public static JPanel makeBoxLayoutPanelX(JComponent[] c)
        Creates a JPanel and adds components on the X_AXIS(Horizontal).
        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to be added.
        Returns:
        BoxLayout JPanel with JComponents on the X_AXIS.
        See Also:
        BoxLayout

      • makeBoxLayoutPanelY

        public static JPanel makeBoxLayoutPanelY(JComponent[] c)

        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to be added.
        Returns:
        BoxLayout JPanel with JComponents on the Y_AXIS.
        See Also:

      • makeBoxLayoutPanelY

        added components on the Y_AXIS(Vertical).
        Returns:
        BoxLayout JPanel with vertical alignment.
        See Also:

        Returns:
        BoxLayout JPanel with vertical alignment.
        See Also:
        BoxLayout

      • wrapInJPanel

        public static JPanel wrapInJPanel(JComponent c)
        Useful to avoid the nasty effects of BoxLayout and GridLayout on preferred sizes.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        c in a JPanel.

      • wrapInJPanel

        public static JPanel wrapInJPanel(JComponent c,
                  LayoutManager m)
        Wraps c in a JPanel with LayoutManager m.
        Parameters:
        c - JComponent to add to the JPanel.
        m - LayoutManger for the JPanel.
        Returns:
        c wrapped in a JPanel with LayoutManager m
        See Also:
        wrapInJPanel(JComponent)

      • wrapInJPanel

        public static JPanel wrapInJPanel(JComponent[] c,
                  GridLayout m)
        Creates a JPanel with GridLayout m and adds the elements of c.
        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to be added.
        m - GridLayout to be used.
        Returns:
        The resulting JPanel.

      • wrapInJPanel

        public static JPanel wrapInJPanel(JComponent[] c,
                  int cols,
                  int rows)
        Creates a JPanel with a LayoutManager of GridLayout with the specified number of columns and rows and adds the items of c to the JPanel.
        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to add to the JPanel
        cols - Number of columns
        rows - Number of rows.
        Returns:
        A JPanel with a GridLayout.

      • wrapInJPanel

        public static JPanel wrapInJPanel(JComponent[] c,
                  LayoutManager m,
                  Object[] args)
        Mainly useful for GridBagLayout.
        c.length must equal args.length.
        Parameters:
        c - Array of JComponents to be added.
        m - LayoutManager to use.
        args - Arguments to use when adding elements in c.
        Returns:
        The resulting JPanel.
        null if c==null or args==null or m==null or c.length!=args.length
